item.title: Kai Cenat Wins $100,000 After Beating Elden Ring Boss
item.description:
Highlights

  • Kai Cenat's impressive victory over Elden Ring Boss Godfrey earned him $100,000 on his first try, showcasing his dedication to entertaining his audience.
  • Despite facing easier bosses, viewers agree that Kai Cenat has improved his skills throughout his playthrough of Elden Ring, keeping them engaged.
  • With an offer to double his winnings on the line, Kai Cenat decided to cash out and continue his journey to conquer Elden Ring, promising his audience an exciting conclusion.

Twitch streamer Kai Cenat won $100,000 after beating Elden Ring Boss Godfrey, First Elden Lord, on the first try. Since its release, Elden Ring has been a wildly popular but notoriously difficult game for many players, similar to the rest of the soulslike genre. Gamers have been finding ways to make their runs more interesting, including various types of challenge runs. Starting in April, Kai Cenat decided to make the most out of his playthrough of Elden Ring .

Early on into his playthrough, Kai Cenat made it clear that he was going to make the most entertaining choices possible for his audience. After starting, Kai Cenat spent 6 hours in Elden Ring fighting the Tree Sentinel , an early game boss. The Tree Sentinel not only serves as a skill check, but an indicator to players that one way to play the game is gaining experience in other areas and coming back for tougher enemies once they have become stronger. Cenat decided to keep playing until he prevailed. As time passed, Kai Cenat improved.

Related
Kai Cenat Destroys Setup in Viral Twitch Clip

Kai Cenat destroys his impressive streaming setup in a viral Twitch clip after losing an intense battle while playing Fortnite.

Kai Cenat won $100,000 fighting the 7th main boss in Elden Ring . After Cenat's Twitch stream picked up popularity, Kick streamer Adin Ross bet Kai Cenat $100,000 that he wouldn’t win his first attempt taking on Godfrey, First Elden Lord. Despite the fact that a previous boss encounter in Elden Ring made Kai Cenat cry on stream , he accepted the bet and prevailed.

Kai Cenat Wins $100,000 Beating Godfrey in Elden Ring

After Kai Cenat beat Godfrey, Adin Ross offered Cenat a chance to make even more money. Kai Cenat was given the opportunity to gamble his win, double or nothing, and receive $200,000 on the next boss. Despite the attractive offer, Cenat decided to take his win, cashing out on the condition that Ross will give Cenat his money when he beats Elden Ring. Some players may believe that Cenat's fight against Godfrey wasn't that much of a challenge; gamers believe Godfrey to be on the list of the easiest bosses in Elden Ring . Despite that, Cenat's audience agrees that he's gotten better at the game.

It is likely that some players may be more interested in seeing Kai Cenat take on the hardest bosses in Elden Ring , compared to the ones that are simply required to beat the game, but players have overall been excited about Cenat's stream because of his commitment. Kai Cenat has promised not to finish his broadcast until he has beaten Elden Ring , and many viewers eagerly anticipate the end.

item.title: Study Claims Pokemon GO is the Buggiest Popular Mobile Game in 2024
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon GO is the buggiest popular mobile game in 2024, with 153.5 bug mentions for every 1,000 reviews, according to a recent study.
  • Despite its issues, Pokemon GO continues to release exciting content like the World of Wonders season and new Legendary forms.
  • Niantic is actively working to improve game stability, but the study shows Pokemon GO's struggle with bugs compared to some other popular games.

Pokemon GO is the buggiest mobile game in 2024, according to a new study. The mobile games industry has grown exponentially, with games like Pokemon GO becoming some of the biggest names. Making players' dreams of becoming Pokemon trainers a reality, Pokemon GO maintains an active community with frequent content releases.

The current Pokemon GO season is the World of Wonders, which has brought new events such as new Community Days, and Diancie's global debut in Pokemon GO after last year's GO Fest. But like other seasons, Pokemon GO hasn't escaped problems that have hampered the players' experience. Examples abound, such as a controversial update that bugged Buddy Pokemon, or the mysterious glitch that gave Pokemon GO an unreleased item to players. Niantic is constantly working to keep the Pokemon GO experience fresh, but a recent study claims that the augmented reality game is less stable than one might think.

Related
Pokemon GO Reveals New Details About Naganadel, Stakataka, and Blacephalon Debuts

Pokemon GO announces Naganadel, Stakataka, and Blacephalon debuts, and gives details on how trainers will be able to catch the trio.

ElectronicsHub has released a study revealing the most bugged mobile games of 2024, and Pokemon GO appears at the top of the list. Analyzing 1.8 million user reviews of the 400 most used apps in the Google Play Store, Pokemon GO registered 153.5 mentions of bugs, crashes, and problems for every 1,000 reviews. Call of Duty: Mobile comes second, while Words With Friends 2 is in third place. The list continues with Clash of Clans (4th), Roblox (5th), Brawl Stars (6th), Toca Life World (7th), the HoYoverse hit Honkai: Star Rail (8th), PUBG MOBILE (9th), and Free Fire Battlegrounds (10th).

Buggiest Popular Mobile Games in 2024 According to Study

  1. Pokemon GO
  2. Call of Duty: Mobile
  3. Words With Friends 2
  4. Clash of Clans
  5. Roblox
  6. Brawl Stars
  7. Toca Life World
  8. Honkai: Star Rail
  9. PUBG MOBILE
  10. Free Fire Battlegrounds

While the most bugged games of 2024 have between 80 and over 150 bug mentions in Google Play Store reviews, the list of the least bugged games published by ElectronicHub follows the opposite path. In first place is the classic game Solitaire , with only 12.9 bug mentions, with Royal Match and Domino Dreams rounding off the top 3. The rest of the list includes Jiggsawescapes (4th), Gin Runny (5th), Block Puzzle: Block Smash Game (6th), Spades (7th), World Trip (8th), Yatzy (9th), and Block Blast (10th).

Bugs in online games are a common occurrence, although Pokemon GO ends up standing out negatively in this respect. Despite this, Niantic continues to work actively to keep the game as interesting and stable as possible, so that players can enjoy exciting content such as New Legendary forms debuting in Pokemon GO .

item.title: World of Warcraft Shows Off Unique Abilities from Mists of Pandaria Remix Event
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players can discover new cross-class abilities and passives in WoW Remix with Cogwheel and Tinker Gems.
  • WoW players can empower their character with ultimate abilities like Chi-Ji transformation using Meta Gems.
  • The WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria event will include accelerated leveling.

World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria is introducing some awesome new spells that can be learned via socketed gems, including cross-class skills, passives, and ultimate abilities. Reminiscent of the Rune engravings from Season of Discovery, these powerful abilities will make the new World of Warcraft game mode truly extraordinary.

Blizzard is introducing a new PvE event called World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria . Starting May 16, players can make new characters to play through Mists of Pandaria at an accelerated rate and with modern convenience and class balance, collecting transmogs and other rewards as they adventure across the 12-year-old expansion.

Related
World of Warcraft Reveals Twitch Drop for Mists of Pandaria Remix Event

World of Warcraft players can pick up an exclusive cosmetic item for free via a Twitch Drop launching alongside the Mists of Pandaria Remix event.

However, there are also some special abilities fans can obtain in World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria that will make the leveling experience unique. By experimenting with over 60 different gems they collect around Pandaria, players can empower their character with new synergies and skills. Cogwheel Gems let players learn abilities from other classes, like Heroic Leap and Vanish, and Tinker Gems provide powerful passives. Meanwhile, Meta Gems grant access to ultimate abilities, such as one that transforms them into Chi-Ji, the Red Crane.

Special Abilities in WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria

  • Cogwheel Gems – Active abilities for the Feet Slot
    • Heroic Leap
    • Sprint
    • Vanish

  • Tinker Gems – Passive abilities for Shoulder, Wrists, Hands, and Waist Slots
    • Bloodthirsty Coral: Dealing damage creates Healing Blood, which is expended to heal the character if injured
    • Brittle: 10% of damage dealt to an enemy hits nearby enemies when they die
    • Deliverance: When healing an injured ally, a portion of all recent healing is split between nearby allies
    • Explosive Barrage: Abilities have a chance to summon a barrage of missiles
    • Freedom: Reduces AoE damage, and periodically frees allies of crowd control.
    • Grounding: Periodically reduces magic damage, and redirects magic attacks from allies to the user
    • Holy Martyr: Damage taken is turned into healing for nearby allies
    • Mark of Arrogance: Attackers receive a DoT
    • Meteor Swarm: Abilities have a chance to summon a hail of meteors
    • Quick Strike: Melee abilities periodically trigger extra auto attacks
    • Savior: Healing a critically wounded ally shields them
    • Slay: Attacking a critically wounded enemy causes them to take damage equal to the user’s max health
    • Storm Overload: Using major class ability deals damage and stuns nearby enemies
    • Sunstrider’s Flourish: Critical strikes cause fiery explosions
    • Tinkmaster’s Shield: Grants a regenerating damage shield

  • Meta Gems – ultimate abilities for the Head Slot
    • Chi-Ji, the Red Crane: Transform into Chi-Ji for 30 seconds, gaining access to new spells
    • Lifestorm: Summon a storm that strikes enemies with lightning and creates healing areas
    • Oblivion Sphere: Creates an orb that increases critical damage to enemies, then explodes

  • Prismatic Gems – Provide stat increases in other slots

In many ways, these special gems and sockets are reminiscent of the Rune engravings from World of Warcraft Classic Season of Discovery . These class-altering abilities give Season of Discovery characters a huge power boost, and even let them fill new party roles in the process. It seems like WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria gems and sockets are modern WoW ’s take on the popular Season of Discovery feature.

Were that not enough, each World of Warcraft Remix character gets a Timerunner’s Cloak that transforms and gains bonus stats throughout the event. With no limit on how powerful it will become, and with its bonuses shared across alts during the event, players should have no trouble farming rare WoW cosmetic items from Mists of Pandaria like the Tusks of Mannoroth .

At the moment, World of Warcraft has not given a solid end date for the Mists of Pandaria Remix event. However, fans noticed the end date on the World of Warcraft Public Test Realm was listed as August 19. While the actual event could end sooner or later than that, a three-month run would be in line with what most players expected from WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria – and right around when the World of Warcraft: The War Within Pre-Patch event is likely to begin .

item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates New Regional Forms for Koffing and Weezing
item.description:
Highlights

  • Cosmic-inspired regional forms for Koffing & Weezing give iconic Gen 1 Pokemon a fresh twist.
  • Earth-based Koffing shifts into smog-covered future Earth & moon-inspired Weezing design.
  • Fans intrigued by unique concept of Terrestrial Koffing & Weezing regional forms.

A Pokemon fan has created unique regional forms for Koffing and Weezing that have interesting cosmic inspiration. The two designs have gained a lot of fans for the concept and for giving two iconic Gen 1 Pokemon attention.

Koffing and Weezing are iconic Poison-type Pokemon that got their start in Pokemon Red and Blue . While the two likely would be remembered for their unique designs regardless, Koffing's (and later Weezing's) presence as James' Pokemon in the TV anime helped to cement its design in pop culture. As just one of the Pokemon that deals with pollution and smog, those concepts came into play in this unique regional fan art.

Related
Pokemon Leak Gives Insight on Generation 10 Release Plans

A reputable Pokemon leaker seemingly teases the release plans for the unannounced Generation 10 Pokemon games.

Pokemon fan Msatratzfratz shared their rendition of Koffing and Weezing , giving them unique regional forms. The two Poison-type Pokemon have become Water/Rock-type and Ground/Rock-type, respectively. At first glance, it's obvious that Koffing is based upon the Earth, recreating its shape by turning its mounds into mountainous surfaces on land, and adding water and clouds to complete the planet-like appearance. Meanwhile, Weezing looks much more dismal, with both heads of the Pokemon having a rocky, smoggy appearance to them.

According to the artist, there's a reason behind the sudden shift from a healthy planet-like Pokemon to what they end up becoming as Weezing. Koffing is supposed to represent the Earth as it currently is, whereas Weezing represents the Earth and moon in the future. The larger of Weezing's two heads has become a dried up, polluted Earth, whereas the smaller head is the moon, which humans now live on in the artist's concept.

Pokemon fans in the comments seem to be intrigued by the designs, with some suggesting alternate typings or concepts. One fan preferred these fan designs to the Galarian Koffing and Weezing that actually appear in the games, while another suggested that these designs might work better as divergent evolutions rather than regional forms. Others mused about space, and wondered if the Pokemon series would eventually see it as a new region to explore.

Refreshing Older Pokemon Designs

When it comes to fan designs for Pokemon , nothing is off the table, and older Pokemon often get revised. Sometimes these designs include Pokemon that have been ignored for years by Game Freak, while others put even more creativity and randomness into Pokemon that have multitudes of evolutions or alternate forms. Pokemon fans often lean into creating unique art celebrating their favorites, so there's no shortage of designs, with over a thousand Pokemon to potentially draw inspiration from. While the more outlandish ideas might not fit into a proper Pokemon game, it's fun for fans to dream about.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Player Shows Off Lae'zel Cosplay
item.description:
Highlights

  • Lae'zel, a fearsome Githyanki fighter in Baldur's Gate 3, inspired one fan to create an amazing cosplay project.
  • Redditor Frau_Haku made a stunning Lae'zel cosplay, becoming an instant subreddit hit.
  • Other fans are crafting intricate projects like a working Xbox controller shaped like Shadowheart's artifact.

A Baldur’s Gate 3 player has revealed their phenomenal cosplay of Lae’zel, the Sword Coast’s most fearsome Githyanki Fighter. Not only has Larian Studio’s Dungeons & Dragons RPG won all five major Game of the Year Awards, but Baldur’s Gate 3 has inspired fans to make some truly amazing creations.

From outcast vampires to pact-bound warlocks, Baldur’s Gate 3 is filled with fascinating characters. Heralding from Crèche K'liir, Lae’zel is a fearsome Githyanki warrior honed by years of battle against her kin’s mortal enemies, the Illithid mind flayers. One of the game’s six playable origin characters, Lae’zel is one of the strongest women in Baldur’s Gate 3 . However, Lae’zel is arguably also one of the game’s most complex and well-written characters. Torn between her duty to Vlaakiith, the domineering Githyanki queen, and the need to purge the mind flayer parasite from her head, Lae’zel's character arc is one of the most intriguing stories in the entire game. As the narrative unfolds, players begin to unravel the many emotional layers of this fan-favorite character, discovering a surprisingly tender personality beneath her brusque exterior.

Related
Baldur’s Gate 3 Director Reveals Interesting Mechanic That Never Made It Into the Game

Larian Studios CEO Sven Vincke shares his original vision for a fascinating Baldur's Gate 3 mechanic which never made it to the final game.

Since its release in August 2023, Baldur’s Gate 3 has inspired countless players to create costumes of their favorite characters. However, like all Githyanki in Baldur’s Gate 3 , Lae’zel’s characteristic yellow-green skin tone, long pointed ears, small nose, and mottled facial markings make her one of the game's more difficult looks to emulate. Redditor Frau_Haku has just defied all these challenges by sharing a picture of their stunning Lae’zel cosplay. Clad in the fighter’s iconic Githyanki Half-Plate armor and wielding a massive 2-handed Githyanki Greatsword, the outfit’s attention to detail is so precise that at first glance the image almost looks straight out of the game.

Lifelike Lae'zel Cosplay Leaves Fans Awestruck

The ensemble is so impressive that the post quickly became the most popular post on the entire r/BaldursGate3 subreddit, gathering almost 62,000 upvotes after only one day – over 20,000 more than the previous highest post. The extremely talented Redditor is no stranger to making costumes from Baldur’s Gate 3 , having previously posted their take on Mizora in both her human and demonic forms and Astarian in his eccentric camp clothes .

Other Baldur’s Gate 3 players have been inspired to make some similarly skillful creations. One fan recently spent five months making a working Xbox controller in the shape of Shadowheart’s mysterious artifact , complete with 20 buttons and motion sensors to simulate thumbsticks. With Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s deluxe editions finally starting to ship, fans can only hope to see more projects and labors of love like these in the future.
